timeline.bodyText:
I like writing out definitions, in which situations certain checked exceptions can be thrown. I think it's good because

it documents this to the clients who call this method (well, duh)
it is a good though exercise. Writing the descriptions forces one to think through about the different exception situations, and often reveals that certain exceptions should be replaced, or not thrown as checked exceptions at all

replies.author: jansu76

timeline.bodyText:
Deciding which cases to identify as checked exceptions is important, but tricky and challenging job. And usually ends up being somewhat subjective. I wrote about the topic in https://confluence.niis.org/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=30212590
In this method we have ProcessNotExecutableException, ProcessFailedException and BackupFileNotFoundException. Question is which ones should be checked exceptions, which not.
ProcessNotExecutableException and ProcessFailedException are wrapped as DeviationAwareRuntimeExceptions. Logic is probably "these mean that something in internal engine is broken, and method's caller is not interested in what. http 500 is enough".
I am maybe a bit dubious about ProcessFailedException, it might make sense to throw it as checked exception....but since that is from generateInternalTlsKeyAndCertificate and other places, lets leave it as it is.
But I would consider wrapping the BackupFileNotFoundException also in an unchecked DeviationAwareRuntimeException? If backup script completed, and still we dont find the backup, isn't that just as much "something in the internals is broken, and all we want to do is http 500" case as "process is not executable"?

timeline.bodyText:
Usually generic advice is that these should use File.separator instead of "/". There is some limited use of File.separator in the codebase already.
DefaultFilepaths.CONF_BACKUP_PATH uses hard coded "/" but maybe there is some tiny change that someone will run this with overridden CONF_BACKUP_PATH on a system with different file separator.
I don't see how File.separator would break otherwise working configuration, so there should not be too much of a downside for changing. But this is not a super important detail. It's more of a style issue.
timeline.author: jansu76

replies.bodyText: You're right, the default configuration includes the trailing /. Since the default value can be overridden, it's possible for an admin to change the location and set the new value without the trailing /. Maybe not very common, but possible. However, I replaced the hardcoded / with File.separator.

timeline.author: jansu76

replies.bodyText:
Before trying to read the file, the given filename is validated against existing backup files. If the given filename does not match to an existing backup filename, BackupFileNotFoundException exception is thrown. The existing backup file names must meet the requirements of the backup filename filter.
https://github.com/nordic-institute/X-Road/pull/385/files#diff-de66d07ae90cf7c796f633208bd7dc09R55
This should prevent access to other than valid backup files.
